meanings.definition: To turn or twist to one side
meanings.sent1: She tried to skew the picture on the wall to make it straight.
meanings.sent2: The dancer's body started to skew as she spun around.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to skew its head in a funny angle while watching the bird.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to skew the truth, making it hard to understand what really happened.
meanings.sent5: The storm's strong winds caused the trees to skew dangerously, threatening to fall over.

meanings.sent1: The crooked path through the forest was quite skew.
meanings.sent2: The old bridge had a skew railing that needed repair.
meanings.sent3: The wonky chair legs made the whole furniture set look skew in the room.
meanings.sent4: Her lopsided smile gave her face a slightly skew appearance.
meanings.sent5: The artist intentionally painted the horizon skew to create a sense of unease in the landscape.

meanings.definition: To distort or bias in a particular direction
meanings.sent1: The news report seemed to skew the facts to favor one side.
meanings.sent2: The researcher's personal beliefs started to skew the results of the study.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to skew the audience's perception of reality.
meanings.sent4: The politician's speech was carefully crafted to skew public opinion in their favor.
meanings.sent5: The mirror in the funhouse managed to skew everyone's reflection, making them look funny.
